channel.title: AoEO Vanilla PVP out!
channel.description:
I know many of you didn't like AoEO due to the fact it was essentially a grind mmo but with rts gameplay.
You should be happy to know that the game now has classic PvP much like the older titles. All tech and units unlocked, and this is the new ranked pvp mode.
The downside is that you need a premium civ to host a game of vanilla pvp, but you can join existing premium players hosting a game with no penalty whatsoever (i am premium, therefore i can host games). Adding to this, they've also introduced a 4 player free for all mode!
Now, who's up for some oldschool villager/tower rushes? :D

item.title: AoEO Vanilla PVP out!
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Tom_BETA, post:8, topic:422156”]AoEo worked fine on my new PC (2GB DDR3 RAM, dual core 3.0 GHZ and a supposedly bad graphics card which works amazingly well on everything). I’m trying this on my old laptop now just to see how choppy it’ll get (1GB DDR2 RAM, 2.0ghz, horrible graphics card ATI).

UPDATE:

I’m shocked - I turned down the graphical settings and I get no lagg at all on this laptop. How do you actually get to the PVP though, Speljohan?[/quote]Around level 5-6 you unlock the arena which allows champion mode.

Read full topic

item.title: AoEO Vanilla PVP out!
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

AoEo worked fine on my new PC (2GB DDR3 RAM, dual core 3.0 GHZ and a supposedly bad graphics card which works amazingly well on everything). I’m trying this on my old laptop now just to see how choppy it’ll get (1GB DDR2 RAM, 2.0ghz, horrible graphics card ATI).

UPDATE:

I’m shocked - I turned down the graphical settings and I get no lagg at all on this laptop. How do you actually get to the PVP though, Speljohan?

Read full topic
